com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast.data

Class StringDelta

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.catalys.util.fast.data.StringDelta

  • public class StringDelta
extends Object
    A StringDelta is the result of a FAST Delta operation on two Strings.

    The idea is to get from one string, the base, to another, the target, you remove n characters from the base string (either the first n characters or the last n characters) and replace them with another String.

      • computeDelta

        public static void computeDelta(String target,
                                String base,
                                StringDelta delta)
        This populates the given delta object with the delta required to convert the given base to the given target.

        In other words:
        target = base + delta

        Parameters:
        target - New string to be computed from base String
        base - Original string
        delta - Delta required to convert base to target

      • computeDelta

        public static void computeDelta(BytesSegment target,
                                BytesSegment base,
                                StringDelta delta)

      • computeValue

        public static void computeValue(IField field,
                                String delta,
                                int subtractionValue,
                                String base,
                                IValue value)
                         throws FastCodecException
        This populates the given value object from the given base and delta and subtractionValue.

        In other words:
        value = base + (delta, subtractionValue)

        Parameters:
        field - Used only if FastCodecException is thrown to provide template and field name
        delta - Delta string to add to base
        subtractionValue - Value indicating which bytes in the base are replaced by the delta. See FAST spec.
        base - Base string value
        value - Resulting value
        Throws:
        FastCodecException - If subtraction value is bigger than base value

      • computeValue

        public static void computeValue(BytesSegment delta,
                                int subtractionValue,
                                BytesSegment base,
                                IValue value,
                                int type)

      • computeValue

        public static void computeValue(BytesSegment delta,

                                IValue value)

      • computeValueAndSetTV

        public static void computeValueAndSetTV(IField field,
                                        BytesSegment bsTV,
                                        BytesSegment bsBase,
                                        int subtractionValue)
                                 throws FastCodecException
        Compute the new value based on delta (initially in bsTV) and base values (in bsBase). Set the new value in bsTV => implicitly setting the new value in TV
        Parameters:
        field - Used only if FastCodecException is thrown to provide template and field name
        bsTV - - Bytes segment representation of TV from input stream (initially contains delta value)
        bsBase - - Bytes segment representation of base value
        subtractionValue - - subtraction value
        Throws:
        FastCodecException - - When subtraction value is not consistent with base value length

      • scan

        public static int scan(boolean fromStart,
                       String s1,
                       String s2)
        Return the number of characters which are the same in the given two strings, s1 and s2, scanning back from the end of the strings (if fromStart is false) or from the front of the strings (if fromStart is true).
        Parameters:
        fromStart - True if we should scan from the start
        s1 - String to compare with s2
        s2 - String to compare with s1
        Returns:
        Number of characters in common

      • scan

        public static int scan(boolean fromStart,
                       BytesSegment s1,
                       BytesSegment s2)
        Return the number of bytes which are the same in the given two BytesSegment's, s1 and s2, scanning back from the end of the segments (if fromStart is false) or from the front of the segments (if fromStart is true).
        Parameters:
        fromStart - True if we should scan from the start
        s1 - Segment to compare with s2
        s2 - Segment to compare with s1
        Returns:
        Number of bytes in common
